alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:04PM EDT until May 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Training of thunderstorms over the higher terrain and recreational areas north of Marquette have seen elevated rainfall totals. Small creeks, rivers, and other recreational areas may have flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Marquette. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marquette and Sugarloaf Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
